title: Longines to Offer 13 Equestrian Pocket Watches in U.S.
text:
Longines 1878 pocket watch Courtesy of Longines

Text size

Swiss luxury watchmaker Longines is bringing 13 individually numbered editions of the Longines Equestrian Pocket Watch collection to its U.S. boutiques in time for the Longines Global Champions Tour of New York later this month. Prices range from $32,000 to $52,000.

The 187-year-old Longines, a subsidiary of The Swatch Group since 1983, is the title partner and official timekeeper of the equestrian event series worldwide. The New York show jumping will be held on Governors Island from Sept. 27 to 28.

The Longines Equestrian Pocket Watch collection has several design models, most of which feature engravings of detailed images of horses, riders, and jockeys. Each model has been issued only in a limited series of 20 pieces worldwide.
description: The timepieces will be displayed for sale during the Longines Global Champions Tour of New York
